data.title: Very good lunch
data.text:
Here we had a very delicious lunch in a beautiful restaurant. Everything was freshly cooked and well arranged on the plate. The dessert was excellent! 
The service was also very good.

data.title: Dinner before Show
data.text: This was a great night out and we ate a lovely dinner at this upscale restaurant next to the Hobby Center.  The service was excellent, food was excellent and it is a must if you are going to a show.  So convenient although you must have reservations (we ate early 6:00) as the show we were going to (Wicked) started at 7:30!  The also give you plantain chips and sauces which is great with the wine we had.  I highly recommend it for a special night out and we are already planning to go back!

data.title: Wicked
data.text: Great experience. Food is definitely worth the price. Empanadas appetizer is delicious. The sides come in large portions that two people can easily share. Dinner was perfect before the show!   Arrive early if you want to park in the garage and reservations are recommended. We were there on a week night and there was not an empty seat in the dinning area or bar area.

data.title: Before the play
data.text: Wonderful! At the bar before the performance. Absolutely yummy! Appetizers pricey but worth it. Empanadas were fabulous!!!

data.title: Great for theater days
data.text: This place is a great start to a girl day at the theater. Service is always good. Love the Goat Cheese Salad and the Scallops with barley risotto!! Good wine list and so easy to have a nice lunch then just walk over to your seats.

data.title: Great Restaurant
data.text: From the time we walked up till the time we left, couldn't have had a better experience anywhere.  Showed up 25 minutes early for our reservations and they set us right down.  The  plantain chips and dip are a fantastic start to the meal.  The ceviche appetizer was excellent.  We had a special of surf and turf as well as a seafood medley.  Both dishes were delicious.  The service was outstanding and our waiter was very knowledgeable about the food as well as the surrounding skyline.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: We had lunch here before wicked musical.. Very conveniently located inside hobby center.. Great food.. Our waiter wasnt the best.. But they were packed so forgivable.. Food decently process and lots of it.. Great atmosphere!!

data.title: Great escape
data.text: Prior to going to see Wicked, we ate at Artista.   This is our second visit to this outstanding restaurant and we will be back many more times.  Their staff is friendly and the food is excellent.  The location is perfect for old farts going to the theater.

data.title: Great stop before the show at Hobby Center
data.text:
My wife and I stopped in for a drink before the Carole King Beautiful show.  Just enough time for a drink and an appy.
Very busy, service was understandibly challenged, food and drink was slow to arrive.  We had some chips/salsa and some spring rolls.  Very tasty.  Would like to go for a full dinner

data.title: Very nice restaurant
data.text: This restaurant is actually in the Hobby Center. They expect reservations so plan ahead. The food is so good. They automatically bring a plate of fried plantain chips with three sauces. My favorite was the white sauce which I believe is their horseradish cream sauce. The red is some raspberry type sauce which was very sweet and then a chimichurri (sp?) sauce. We ordered an appetizer of the friend oyster and beef tenderloin crostini which was good however I didn't like the combo together. I had the Seafood Paella which is usually served with tilapia but I switched it for salmon. It was all very tasty. It is a pretty pricy meal so don't go if you are on a budget. The service was beyond outstanding and I would love to go back for a special occasion!

data.title: Excellent Food & Service within the Hobby Center
data.text: Even though this restaurant is located within the Hobby Center, it is easily accessible and of course has valet parking.  We enjoy having dinner here prior to attending the performances.  It is so nice to have a fantastic dinner and drinks and walking right into the theatre for the performance.  The food is always wonderful and the service is always prompt.  The churassco steak is our favorite and the Caesar salad is a conversation piece and delicious.

data.title: Great service by Mary. Great food as alwasy.
data.text: We like to eat at Artista when downtown for a play or otherwise.  This trip was excellent as always.  Mary did a magnificent job and Alex the manager checked on us as he did most diners.  The food was terrific.  We look forward to our return.  Thank you Fred, Alex and Mary for another wonderful meal.

data.title: Drinks and dessert before the show
data.text: To ensure we get parking for the TUTS shows, we show up an hour early and enjoy a drink and dessert at Artista.  Typically, they are very busy, but we can usually find a spot on the balcony or in the bar area.  They make a good lemon drop martini, and their tres leches is one of the best I've ever had!!

data.title: Good pre-performance choice
data.text: High quality food in good quantity, with timely, cordial service. Both meals were seafood, and both excellent.

data.title: Food should be much better
data.text:
There were good points and bad points to our visit.
On the good side - 
*Atmosphere was very nice. Although it was packed the evening went, you could still hold a conversation without raising your voice.
*Service was spot on. Jelani was very pleasant, and we never waited for refills and he just had a wonderful attitude.
On the bad side-
For the prices you pay here, the quality of the food should be consistently amazing.  We did not find that here. My wife's Risotto was mushy with the consistency of grits. Her salmon and asparagus were average. I tried the salmon and in my opinion, it was over cooked.  I had the snapper and mine was definitely over cooked. Almost like it was leftover and reheated in a microwave. I had the cup of Gumbo before the snapper and I've definitely had better. No real spice or heat to it at all.

Overall, I wouldn't say it was the worst, but as I said before, for the prices here, it should be much better.

data.title: Lovely View, Delicious Food
data.text: I have only had lunch at Artista, and find it very reasonable. The portions are generous, and the staff attentive. Another person at the table has dined there prior to a theater performance at the Hobby Center and commented that they are very efficient at getting you out in time for the shows.

data.title: Good
data.text: Location was convenient if your going to the theatre and views were good. Food and desert was great. The service was okay.

data.title: Great Service, Great Views and Great Food
data.text: We always go to Artista before a play.  The service is excellent and the the food is fabulous.  You can sit outside and view downtown.  Nice wine list and menu.

data.title: Over priced
data.text: Dined there 4 times because of Hobby Center shows (convenient location).  Prices are too expensive if based on the quantity.  All appetizers are "one" bite size... no kidding.  Chimichurri has very good flavor.  Will we come back?  Probably not... tiny quantity and over priced.

data.title: Very cool!
data.text: Ambiance, good service, beautiful view of downtown buildings, really varied menu, the presentation of the food was great!
